title: The Eater Philly Cocktail Heatmap: Where to Drink Now, February 2017
text:
Feb 7, 2017, 5:00pm EST Center City's Harp & Crown Hillary Petrozziello 
If you want to know the hottest new places to eat in Philly right now, you check the Eater Heatmap . Now, it's just as easy to figure out where to drink, rightthisveryminute. 
Enter Eater Philly's Cocktail Heatmap , your guide to the hottest drinking dens and restaurant bars of the moment serving up notable cocktails. Rather than featuring the perennial favorites, this list focuses on operations that have opened in about the last year, or have in some way transformed their bar program, and is updated regularly to keep things fresh. 
For February, we say farewell to Restaurant Neuf , Martha , and Southwark , all of which have been open a while now. In their place, welcome the bookish Writer's Block Rehab , plush pub Harp & Crown , and St. Benjamin Taproom , courtesy of the brewery's new Bloody Mary program. 
Note that the points on the map are arranged from south to north, and aren't ranked. Happy drinking. 1 ITV 
Top Chef winner Nick Elmi's new spot on East Passyunk Avenue may bill itself as a wine bar, but the cocktails here are just as serious. Fascinating combinations of top-shelf liquors, all of which pair wonderfully with Elmi's version of bar bites and small plates. Caviar service is now a thing in South Philly, and ordering it with a tarragon-spiked champagne cocktail, while an exercise in opulence, is a damn fine way to spend an evening out.
